results.adx_keywords: World Cup 2022 (Soccer);Soccer;News and News Media;Deaths (Obituaries);Wahl, Grant (1974-2022)
results.byline: By Kevin Draper and Alan Blinder
results.title: Soccer Journalist Dies at World Cup After Collapsing at Argentina Game
results.abstract: Grant Wahl, who in his career covered soccer for Sports Illustrated, Fox Sports and CBS, was in Qatar for his eighth men’s World Cup.

media.caption: Grant Wahl in a 2014 photo. He died on Friday while covering the World Cup.
media.copyright: Fred Kfoury III/Icon Sportswire, via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Weather;Snow and Snowstorms;Pacific Northwestern States (US);Sierra Nevada Region (US);Great Plains (US);Southern States (US)
results.title: Winter Weather Havoc Is Expected to Make a Cross-Country Run
results.abstract: A “major storm system” is forecast to rumble across the U.S., bringing feet of snow to the West, blizzard conditions in the Northern Plains and tornadoes across the South, forecasters say.

media.caption: An image from a California Department of Transportation traffic camera showing Interstate 80 at the Donner Summit in California’s northern Sierra Nevada mountains Saturday.

results.title: Surprise. The Villain So Far in ‘Harry & Meghan’ Is Not the Royal Family.
results.abstract: Harry and Meghan focused their ire in their Netflix documentary on the tabloids they say have hounded them out of remorseless greed and scarcely concealed racism.

media.caption: Prince Harry, center, and his wife, Meghan Markle, attending a service for Queen Elizabeth II in June.

results.adx_keywords: Television;Comedy and Humor;internal-sub-only;Noah, Trevor (1984- )
results.title: Trevor Noah Tearfully Signs Off from ‘The Daily Show’
results.abstract: Noah told viewers not to be sad, saying, “You should be happy — the African leader is peacefully leaving power. That is never a guarantee.”

media.caption: Noah ended his seven-year run hosting “The Daily Show” with an emotional shoutout to Black women.

results.adx_keywords: Beaches;Coast Erosion;Shipwrecks (Historic);Archaeology and Anthropology;Meide, Chuck;Daytona Beach Shores (Fla);Florida
results.byline: By Christine Hauser and Jesus Jiménez
results.title: That Mysterious Object on a Florida Beach? It’s a Shipwreck.
results.abstract: Last month people noticed wood jutting from the sand in Daytona Beach Shores. Speculation ran wild, but archaeologists now say it was a ship, most likely a 19th-century merchant vessel.

media.caption: Archaeologists studying a wooden structure in the sand in Daytona Beach Shores, Fla., on Tuesday. A maritime archaeologist said it was most likely the wreck of a merchant ship from the 1800s.

results.adx_keywords: Griner, Brittney;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Brooke Army Medical Center
results.title: Brittney Griner Is Being Taken to an Army Hospital in San Antonio
results.abstract: The hospital treats both civilians and military personnel who have survived torture or other trauma.

media.caption: The Brooke Army Medical Center has long been a place to send patients who need to be debriefed or require sensitive medical care.
media.copyright: Jordan Vonderhaar for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Generation Z;Costumes;Richardson, Haley Lu (1995- )
results.title: The Misfires Are the Point: Dressing Gen Z for ‘The White Lotus’
results.abstract: The show’s costume designer sees your mean tweets. Here’s how she created the younger characters’ divisive looks.

media.caption: Portia (Haley Lu Richardson) blissing out in paradise in an embroidered sweater vest. The younger characters on “The White Lotus” express themselves “in a really adventurous, chaotic way,” according to Alex Bovaird, the show’s costume designer.

results.title: Kyrsten Sinema Says She Will Leave the Democratic Party
results.abstract: The Arizona senator is registering as an independent, noting that she “never fit perfectly in either national party.”

media.caption: Senator Kyrsten Sinema of Arizona speaking in Washington last month after passage of the same-sex marriage bill.

results.abstract: Critics on both sides of the Atlantic found common ground in negative reviews of the first three episodes of the series.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Black People;World War II (1939-45);Discrimination;Decisions and Verdicts;United States Defense and Military Forces;Albert H. King;Robert Lummus;United States Army;Northeastern University;Fort Benning (Ga)
results.title: Army Corrects the Record About a Black Soldier Killed by a White Sergeant in 1941
results.abstract: Private Albert H. King is one of dozens of Black service members believed to have been killed on or near U.S. bases because of their race but whose stories were largely papered over.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: A white U.S. Army sergeant fatally shot a Black private in 1941 as he walked on the main road at Fort Benning near Columbus, Ga., according to military records.

results.adx_keywords: Computers and the Internet;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Foreign Workers;Visas;Labor and Jobs;Immigration and Emigration;United States
results.title: Tech Layoffs in U.S. Send Foreign Workers Scrambling to Find New Jobs
results.abstract: Workers on visas, many of them waiting years for green cards, now face having to leave the country unless they get hired within 60 days.

media.caption: Abhi Jain was laid off from his job as a software engineer at Microsoft. Mr. Jain and his family faced uncertainty after the layoff until he recently received his green card.
media.copyright: Jovelle Tamayo for The New York Times

results.title: What Is Stiff Person Syndrome?

results.byline: By Anton Troianovski and Valerie Hopkins
results.title: News Analysis: In Brittney Griner Deal, Putin Used Pain, a Familiar Lever
results.abstract: By seizing the basketball star, the Russian president made things so painful for the U.S. that it capitulated and turned over a convicted arms dealer. Can the same tactic work in the war in Ukraine?

media.caption: The Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout in a temporary cell in Bangkok, Thailand, after his arrest there in 2010.

results.adx_keywords: Dancing;Social Media;Television;internal-sub-only;Ortega, Jenna (2002- );Netflix Inc
results.title: The Wednesday Dance Is an Invitation. Be Weird.
results.abstract: Jenna Ortega’s dance for her Addams Family character is a viral sensation, but why? It is disarming and defiant: the dance of a nonconformist.

media.caption: A dance by Jenna Ortega, who plays the title role in “Wednesday,” created a sensation.

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Pregnancy and Childbirth;Vaccination and Immunization;Babies and Infants;Influenza
results.title: The Covid Pandemic’s Hidden Casualties: Pregnant Women
results.abstract: Many expectant women have avoided vaccination, unaware that the virus poses great risks to both fetus and mother.

media.caption: Only 70 percent of women completed the primary vaccination series for Covid before or during pregnancy, and only 14 percent have opted for a booster shot.
